website_summaries.verdict: A highly effective all-natural hip and joint remedy in one tasty chew dogs love.
pros: Increases energy level of some dogs, thanks to the premium supplement made since 1991
A must-have for dogs with mobility issues
Has balance of 6 powerful and active ingredients
Picky dogs love the taste and some coats look amazing after long-term use
Good for dogs with sensitive stomachs
cons: May take weeks or months before any results are apparent
Some dogs might not like the flavor
could cause gas or loose stools

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product without consulting a vet
customer_reviews.text: I started giving my dog this and it gave her diarrhea and made her vomit. I do not recommend this product without consulting a vet.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Helped quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: We had started our dog on glucosamine a few months ago. He has some pretty serious joint stiffness and his vet suggested it. We saw a small improvement in his limping. When it was time to reorder we found this product. Our dog has been taking it for a couple of weeks now and there is a marked improvement. He's a got a little limp at night still but it is way better than it was before. We will continue him on these supplements.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended by this Vet Tech!
customer_reviews.text: I work as a vet tech/dog trainer and highly recommend this product to many clients that come in. It's a great daily supplement for dogs of all ages never too early to get your dog on a great Glucosamine supplement! My dog is extremely picky and she loves the taste of these. They're also great for my senior dog, we saw a change even after a couple weeks. She gets around much easier and has an easier time getting up from laying down as well.
customer_reviews.author: Caity

customer_reviews.title: No Positive Impact Perceived - Limp eliminated using Cosequin DS
customer_reviews.text: These made absolutely no impact to my limping german mix using the recommended dosage through 2 bottles. I would normally not be this critical of a product, but I purchased the Cosequin DS max strength plus MSM from Costco immediately after using the last of the Doggie Dailies, and within a week of taking the ramping dosage, I noticed a significant difference in his movement and disposition. His limp has entirely disappeared after a half a bottle of Cosequin. I should have listened to the Vet when she informed me the Doggie Dailies not an effective product.
customer_reviews.author: KRB

customer_reviews.title: My Yorkie is like a new dog
customer_reviews.text: My full size Yorkie we recently rescued was diagnosed with luxating patellas. I put him on a regimen of this joint supplement, salmon oil for dogs, and a grain free diet to reduce inflammation and increase joint health. In only 2 weeks, he is like a new dog, activity increased 10 fold and only the rare occasion of the lifting backleg symptom of luxating patellas (this action helps the dog to get the trick knee back into a normal position). His symptoms were very frequent, e.g. 20-30 times a day previously. Another dog owner on a blog made the above recommendations, I am so thankful to all the people who leave reviews so I had to leave this one also.
customer_reviews.author: SueRae

customer_reviews.title: Quality supplement that our dog loves
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended we give our 11 year old arthritic black lab, Bailey, a daily supplement to help with his mobility. We tried Doggie Dailies & couldn't be happier. We give him 3 squares in the morning and 3 more with his evening dinner. We truly believe he is already moving around more comfortably, and his appetite has come back. There were times when he wouldn't eat a bite of his breakfast or dinner, but now placing the Doggie Dailies in his food bowl, he certainly cleans his plate. Bailey loves these as if they were his favorite treats, and my wife & I love them for helping him live well. 100% great product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lamphere

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: I failed to read the negative reviews on this product for buying it. I wanted to get my 8-year-old German Shepherd something to help with his joints. After a few weeks on this product he was randomly throwing up, diarrhea, and blood in his stool. I thought maybe he got into something or just isn't feeling well. Come to find out it was this product all long. I threw it away, problem solved. You've been warned!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Dogs Having Mobility Issues
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old Bull Terrier has so much more mobility now by being on this product. If she was laying for a long time, it was hard for to get up. After about two weeks of being on this product, she has NO mobility issues. She's like 2 again :)
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dogs digestive system.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I’m in the boat of these giving my dog bowel issues. I know each dog is different. So it’s hard to say wether or not they will affect other people’s dogs this way. My dog never has “accidents”. But after a week or two of these she was having bowel movement accidents regularly. We stopped giving her these and they went away. She weighs around 14lbs. Maybe we should have tried less than the recommended amount. I don’t want to even try though. I’m going back to the ones from Walmart for her. They worked better.
customer_reviews.author: 'standard

customer_reviews.title: I thought these would be great for my aging English Springer's hips
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be great for my aging English Springer's hips. After taking them for a month he started sleeping alot and it seemed he was getting worse also getting systs alot. I stopped giving them to him systs have cleared up his energy is back. After 2 weeks he is back to his old self. Not good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Sorry about this review.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry about this review. Sad to say, it didn't work well as far as the limping of my GSD is concerned. Oh, and after a couple of days, te stool of my dog became ver soft! The the other brand we were using had really good results. Anyway, I have shifted back to the other brand and will observe if the limping of my GSD disappears. Then I can make a follow-up review...if follow-up review is even possible. Could arepresentative of this product tell us mor about their return policy?
customer_reviews.author: balko

customer_reviews.title: Made her worse
customer_reviews.text: My dog actually seemed to get worse..stopped giving them and she bounced back after awhile. I take supplements and some work some don't..could just be they don't agree with her.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Crumbs!
customer_reviews.text: My original review: I likely wouldn’t buy this product again. The treats are very crumbly and half of the package arrived in crumbs. Giving them 1 star. Updated: While I was disappointed with the product, the customer service from Doggie Dailies is SUPERB!! I never asked for anything in return, just giving my feedback on the product. Doggie Dailies refunded my money without me even asking and noticed me via email! I’m in the customer service industry and this is above and beyond the call of duty. Very rare and impressive!! I’d give the customer service 5 stars so I’m changing my review to be neutral. Thank you Doggie Dailies for excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: I had my dog on these for over three years and the 23% crude fat I believe help contributed to my dogs recent diagnosis of Pancreatitis. I don't feed my dog any table scraps or any processed grocery store treats nor is his food of inferior quality. I only gave my dog the best of the best including filtered water. I wish I wasn't naive to this crude fat being so hard on the pancreas as the medication for this disease is $300 a month and my dog will die from this now. I believed all the bs hype on this product but my dog has been off it for a month and is fine without it.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Effective product
customer_reviews.text: Subscribed to these for my 6-year-old dog who has pretty bad arthritis. These supplements really seem to help him with day-to-day pain and stiffness, but I would recommend pairing these with a stronger/different brand over time simply because there are some days/seasons where these just are not enough. He eats them like they are treat AND they work excellent as pairs with regular pills. He has to take phenobarbital twice daily for his epilepsy, and I can squish the pills into these Doggie Dailies treats and he eats them right up. They smell as you would expect them to smell, and a jar lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 11 year old lab/border collie mix after noticing the limping was present even when there was no running. He weighs approx 95 lbs. Started with 6 chews per day, now down to 4 per day. I use the subscribe and save program for these and find I am able to cancel monthly deliveries because they last longer than 1 month.... actually last close to 2 months. I am amazed at how well these work. There is no more limp (unless after heavy play/running) and his skin is much less flaky in the winter months, and coat is soft and shiny. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: My dog love them!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is picky. The first time I put them in his bowl, he sniffed them thoroughly, because he doesn't like anything that will keep him healthy. He loves them and now when he sees me put them in the bowl, he will immediately come over and eat those and leave the food for later. As a person that frequently has to shove things down his throat because pill pockets and hiding them in hot dogs, cheese, etc. don't work, it is great relief to have him look forward to something. BTW, my vet says adding fish oil with these improves effectiveness. "The sum effect is greater than each alone."
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: I had doubts, but they do seem to make a difference.
customer_reviews.text: We started out with 5 of these per meal (morning and evening) and she seems to do better with them. At one point we dropped them down to 3 per meal and we noticed she was limping a bit more, so we went back to 5. Unfortunately our dog is just getting old and it's getting harder for her to move. I can't say much about the flavor since I have never tasted them, but they actually smell decent. We were hiding them in her food, but she seemed to leave the peanut butter ones behind. We just switched to chicken and she has no issue with them being mixed in her food.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: My 12+ year old Pitbull developed very bad stomach issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm revising my one star review with an apology. I have, after many months, discovered that my 12.5 year old pitbull girl is highly allergic to fish oil. Her doctor, our neighbor whom we trust with no doubt, prescribed very good, reputable fish oil for my senior dog. She within 3 days was very sick with nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. It was the fish oil. I will buy this product again, just not for a dog who has a highly sensitive stomach. Thanks for the refund.
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: So grateful for this stuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked wonders for my 11 year old puggle who developed mild to moderate arthritis. She started to struggle getting up and down steps and was overall just slowing down (so hard to watch!) I’ve kept her on this for the past year and she’s zipping up and down steps, running around outside, & just her normal self again! And - SHE LIKES THE “TREAT!” I’ve tried multiple supplements that she wouldn’t eat. Thank you, Doggie Dailies! 🐶
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Engel

customer_reviews.title: 11 Year Old Pyrenees Mix Rescue Approved
customer_reviews.text: Tried these instead of our usual hip/joint supplement for our 11 year old rescue girl. She’s been on a hip/joint supplement for a few years now. She can be picky especially with anything she seems “medicine” but she likes these just fine. Eats them like they are a treat. Only complaint is she gets 5 a dose according to her weight-so we are going through the container quickly. Would recommend - as she seems to enjoy them and more importantly is comfortable on them (running, jumping into the couch, enjoying the life our sweet girl deserves). Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: locknload

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I do not know if the flavor deserves 5 stars because I didn’t eat any. I gave 5 stars for flavor because they don’t smell bad, so I’m hoping that means they tasted good to our dog. Our dog was an old girl, 10+. We started giving these to her because she was having trouble with her back end (hips/legs). After taking these, she seemed very spry and much more energetic! We did continue to purchase these until her passing recently. She passed away due to other medical complications and old age. If I had another dog who needed some help in that area, I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to see how well these worked before writing my review. Well, they have out-performed my expectations! My 13-year old Jack Russell had lost the bounce in her step and was starting to show/act her age. She is also finicky about what she eats. Within 2 weeks or starting her Doggie Dailies, she was more active, jumps more easily and is walking on her hind legs again when excited! Did I mention that she loves her "treats?" These have literally taken years off her, and she is acting like a much younger dog! I will definitely be buying Doggie Dailies from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn F.

customer_reviews.title: I won’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this brand for a while now and have never had a problem until the last 2 times we’ve bought them. As you can see in the picture when we get to the bottom of the container there are a lot of tiny pieces that you can’t really use. The price of of the chews isn’t cheap and I feel like I’m waisting my money because of the tiny pieces that can’t be used. I won’t buy them again
customer_reviews.author: Denise Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Big difference
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed since adding these to my dog diet he want to walk more often and his IVDD is not as bad as it used to be. He is still slow moving but he like to walk every day now.It only been a few weeks so we will see if he moves faster. But Im loving the improvement so far. I used to notice how sore he would be after a long walk. Now he seems to be ok. He can go on longer walk now and is able to still go and enjoy a walk the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beneficial Support
customer_reviews.text: My German shepherd and yellow lab, 5 and 8 yrs old has shown good result consuming these supplement. I noticed they got shinier and thick fur which is beneficial living in NY. I take glucosamine and chondroitin myself and helped me with joint pain so I would like to support my friends with same care.They are very active and strong with healthy food and joint support. I wish for them to live happy and healthy throughout their life span. As long as I can afford it, I would buy it.
customer_reviews.author: normie

customer_reviews.title: They work from what I can tell
customer_reviews.text: These seem to work great. My tenant has and older dog and after watching her struggle all the time with her hips and back legs I decided if I was going to give her treats let’s see if I can help her out so I got these. I can tell you the old gal is definitely noticably getting around better. Too bad her owner doesn’t take care of her better but I’m here !! Feels good to help a struggling animal .. although a little pricey kudos to your product .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware That The Package Doesn't Contain 225 Chews
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product twice. First one- I didn't pay attention when I started giving my dog. But when it was finished, I felt it was so quick giving that there is supposed to be 225 chews inside the box. I purchased the second one and I was out before a month again. There were hardly 150 chews inside. Won't bother buying again.
customer_reviews.author: TGDS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews and bought these on a subscription. Everything sounded good. Ingredient wise they sound excellent. Why such a low rating then? Because my dog won’t eat them. 😢 I have to hid them in another type of food to get them in her. Which I don’t understand, they smell peanut buttery and she really likes peanut butter. But alas- she doesn’t like them so ... they’re a no go for this pooch.
customer_reviews.author: ma_kat

customer_reviews.title: Allergic reaction - Golden Retriever
customer_reviews.text: Stopped giving our Golden these shortly after start of 2nd bottle as he was having an allergic reaction (skin and ears). 2 weeks later he has cleared up. He is 8 now and is slower to stand from hard floors. I did not see much improvement when he was on the chewables. I wanted these to work out. Just leaving a recommendation for those who use limited ingredient dog food and are already aware of allergies to avoid or at least use caution with these.
customer_reviews.author: Clynnt

customer_reviews.title: Works well for large breed dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have two large breed dogs (110 lb +) that are over 10 years old. We noticed some stiffness and our vet recommended Glucosamine. We tried several different brands, but all gave the dogs diarrhea. I ordered these based on the recommendations and they work!! No stomach problems and noticeable improvement in mobility. Couple of things to note: * We give each dog 3 supplements in morning and 3 at night. * They prefer the chicken flavor over peanut butter. I also think the chicken smells better than the peanut butter! * We also switched our dogs to a salmon based food. * We've been giving these supplements for over a year. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M Manning

customer_reviews.title: My Corgi is so much better!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 7 year old corgi that had a pretty bad limp. The vet said nothing was broken and nothing appears to be something he could fix. Gave me a steroid for him. Nothing really changed. He is a very active limping dog. Loves to chase his ball. We were stumped as to what to do and decided to try Doggie Dailies. We were thinking this isn't really working. He loves them as a treat.... However, towards the end of the container I realized my sweet boy was not limping at all!!!! Wait can it be this???? We think-YES it is! We are so happy to have our buddy back and highly recommend this very wonderful product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: This is not safe for dogs it will make your dog sick
customer_reviews.text: Please avoid giving this to your dog. My dog has had severe diarrhea and as soon as I stop giving him this he got better. If you trust this product I would consult a vet first and I would definitely pay attention to my dog. if I was anyone interested in this I would just avoid this product there are much better products out there that are safer for dogs
customer_reviews.author: cue55

customer_reviews.title: Made a big difference for our dog!!
customer_reviews.text: We started giving these to my German Shepard about a year ago. He was always groaning and struggling to get up off the floor, and we could tell his joints were starting to bother him. Since he has started taking these, we have noticed a considerable difference! He no longer limps around, no more groaning to get up, and he doesn’t struggle to stand. We have been very happy with Doggie Dailies. He loves the flavor and is always waiting at the treat jar in the morning to get his “treats”.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney R. Green

customer_reviews.title: So awesome can't get enough
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 dogs.... a 10 year old and a 1 year old. Both take doggie dailies! Both think they are treats. We have tried other supplements in the past, all were good but with doggie dailies i have seen huge differences in our old dog. He is walking faster and even tried jumping on the couch which he hasn't done is years. We were happy with our last supplement but they were out of stock.. doggie dailies has extended my old dogs life and made our house full of excitement!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Banana

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent supplement. My one pug has a bad hip and the other one has a bad knee. I bought this and gave them 2 each for about 2 months and ran out. I went with another brand but both pugs started having pain and mobility issues. Reordered these and once again pain free and no limping. Looks like they'll be taking this daily now forever! Much safer than prescription meds on their organs and very, very effective.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie newsome

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about pain relief as we are giving these to an older dog as a precautionary recommended by our vet. These won't specifically recommeded but our previous dog seemed to get great relief and comfort from these specific ones so as long as the ingredients and service don't change, we will continue to buy this brand. I will say they don't smell appealing and our little dog almost turned her nose up to them, almost, she's very food motivated and didn't want to leave "food" behind and with no problem gobbling it up. So taste must not be bad, they just may smell off putting.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha M. Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Miracle for my sweet pup!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a miracle for my Labrador retriever. She’s 11 and has bad hips and a CCL surgery. She started urinating upon standing up (from straining) leaving really large puddles all over the house. After a vet visit we tried antibiotics - no relief. After a solid 6 weeks of treats the urinating stopped completely! I’m beyond thrilled! I give them to my big mutt too since he also had CCL repair a decade ago and has arthritis. Both dogs gobble them up. I highly recommend these treats!
customer_reviews.author: P. Haskew

customer_reviews.title: Great supplement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this supplement because my dog, Pearl has elbow dysplasia in her front legs and was limping. She was officially diagnosed and there is not a surgical procedure at this time. They recommended several supplemental ingredients for me to try and help with her inflammation and discomfort. I searched for many days and decided to give Doggie Dallies a try. I was concerned at first because the first 30 days I did not notice much improvement but at 60 days her limp was essentially gone which meant she was getting relief from her symptoms. I will continue with this product to give my dog the best quality of life possible with this diagnosis.
customer_reviews.author: PearlBird

customer_reviews.title: I really hate to write bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I have two 13 yo dachshunds. One of them started limping again, it usually happens with cold weather, so I was more than happy to find your product, especially with so many great reviews. I got it three days ago and started to give therm the product right away. Both of my dogs got sick, one is having diarrhea, the other one is vomiting and made a few trips outside last night. Guess I have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Evee

customer_reviews.title: Careful with this product
customer_reviews.text: My Chihuahua had a serious negative reaction, apparently allergic; took a few days to leave her system/body. She was really suck for various days. I'm not quite sure if it's a bad product with low quality ingredients or if it was just that my dog was intolerant or allergic. If you decide to purchase this product, I suggest that you initially give your pet a small piece and be very observative.
customer_reviews.author: MD, Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn't typically have any issues with introducing new treats, food, etc. However, this supplement gave my dog really bad diarrhea, I followed the suggestion on the bottle and gave with food. I know there are cheaper version of this supplement, but I went with this one because I was hoping there would be better ingredients and less chance of something like this happening. He does really need a joint supplement, so I'm really bummed, I only tried this kind one night, but I am hesitant to give it another shot today..... :-(
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Hodne

customer_reviews.title: ABH NATURE’S PRODUCTS, INC, ABH PHARMA, INC, STOCKNUTRA.COM, INC. Issues Nationwide Recall
customer_reviews.text: ABH NATURE’S PRODUCTS, INC, ABH PHARMA, INC., and STOCKNUTRA.COM, INC. Issues Nationwide Recall of All Lots of Dietary Supplement Products !ABH NATURE’S PRODUCTS, INC, ABH PHARMA, INC., and STOCKNUTRA.COM, INC. Issues Nationwide Recall of All Lots of Dietary Supplement Products
customer_reviews.author: CHINATOUCHE1

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results in only a few weeks!
customer_reviews.text: These are great and really help our Papillion! She was having issues with one of her hips and knees...tenderness sometimes to the point of limping or welpping when touched the wrong way. Our vet told us in was inherent with the breed as they age and reccomended joint supplements. Wow what a difference after only a few weeks of using this product! She is no longer suffering from sore joints and pain! Our dog is a very picky eater and she has no issues eating these. They do not have a bad odor or taste...yes I tasted one lol. They are very soft too. I highly recommend these if your fur baby is having joint issues, they really work great!
customer_reviews.author: Monte

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to thre negative reviews!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product as prescribed. After 32 days, my dog is having severe diarrhea and vomiting. Couldn't figure out why, luckily remembered something about this happening when I purchased this. Ignored the info since product got so many stars. Stopped giving him this stuff, and seeing good improvement. Have to research a safer product.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Received from flavor but dog seem to be ok with it
customer_reviews.text: I can’t give any stars for pain relief cause we just got them this second. I had placed order for peanut butter flavor received chicken flavor, my lab did eat 5 with no issue. I had to go in & check my subscription service to make sure the other 6 weeks were set to be peanut butter not chicken cause as we all know dogs will always go for peanut butter not always chicken. I will re write my review once my lab has finished this bottle. We only brought these cause my dogs neurologist said it wouldn’t hurt for him to be on something like this after suffering from ANNPE.
customer_reviews.author: Lper1234@

customer_reviews.title: Improvement Seen after 2 weeks in 10yo Rottie!
customer_reviews.text: Our rottie is 10+ yrs old and was moving slowly. Vet suggested glucosamine and I read reviews on this product. She is finicky with food anyway so some days she will eat the kibbles and other days she turns her nose up to it. After 2 weeks, we saw a little difference. After 3 weeks, she was more active, and became more like her playful self again. 4 weeks in and she is moving around much better. So happy! We are pleased with the results and ordering our second canister. My baby 'dawgter' feels so much better! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Barb H

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 way through container they have all crumbled.
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 way through container they have all crumbled. When I opened there were a few that were crumbled & I chalked it up to shipping. As I used more product it appeared that they kept getting dryer, loosing consistency to the point that they are just pieces parts instead of cubed. USELESS! Product may have beneficial properties but requires a better delivery system!!!!
customer_reviews.author: chauncey2

customer_reviews.title: Apparently taste awful
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say if they work well or not yet, but I can say neither of my 2 dogs (Labrador and Great Pyrenees) will eat them. They are crumbly and smell fine, kind of like peanut butter, but apparently taste awful. My dog has eaten cat turds multiple times and seems to enjoy them but will not eat these unless I smash them in wet food. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dabirrs

customer_reviews.title: Order yours today. Product is a miracle.
customer_reviews.text: This supplement saved my dogs life. Before using my dog Emma was having great difficulty walking and my siberian husky was limping badly both due to severe arthritis. Since finding this both fogs are walking easily without limps or falls. The dogs love these so i guess they taste really great. They eat them like they are a snack. I just order my second bottle. The results are truly truly amazing. If your dog suffers from old age or arthritis this supplement will have them behaving like a puppy again.
customer_reviews.author: Patti V

customer_reviews.title: This product really works! Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These have made a HUGE difference in my sweet girl's life, she was suffering a great deal even with prescription medications and I added these to her daily medications and WOW I don't see pain in her eyes everyday now! To the makers Thank you with all my heart and to those looking to ease their fur babies pain get these now! Don't wait. They are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma nurse

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for and these suck
customer_reviews.text: These have less then 1/2 the dose of the main ingredient vs other popular brands ... thus 1/2 the price. Since I switched to these I noticed my dog much more less willing to go up and down stairs because he was in pain. I’ve switched back to the previous brand and he’s doing MUCH Better again. Note, even when I doubled the dosage of these I didn’t see any improvement from my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Dusza

customer_reviews.title: Upset stomach-will not buy again
customer_reviews.text: My dog was in these for about two weeks. He started vomiting. I think they upset his stomach as that was the only change in his diet. We stopped giving them to him and vomiting stopped. I didn’t see any relief in his joint movement. He is 12 years old and was hoping it would give him a little more relief. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Supplement seems effective
customer_reviews.text: I have only been giving these to my dog for about a week. He has not had any diarrhea episodes, but I did start with only giving him one chew at a time for a few days, then increased it to 2 chews at a time. So far, no issues. He does seem to be more comfortable, and has even started jumping up on the bed again. He is a 75 lb. lab and 12 1/2 years old. He is on Rimadyl, and I am hopeful that I can take him off that and only use the supplement. I am very pleased with the product, and I anticipate purchasing more when I finish the container I have at home.
customer_reviews.author: chocolabmom

customer_reviews.title: Gave my two dogs lose stools
customer_reviews.text: Tried giving just one or two chews a day to my two dogs (normal dose with be 5). One dog has weaker hip joint and limps after too much running or laying down. The other was getting a chew to not feel left out. Both got upset tummies and lose stools. Tried switching on/off and they got lose stools only on the days when they got this chew. Taste-wise, both enjoyed it. Switched to technyflex, and the dog that has weaker hip joins was happily running around and acting noticeably more playful by day 3.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit with watch

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my boy
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write this review until my dog finished the entire container. I fed him theses joint treats according to the directions, but he did not get any relief. He ate them no problem, so they must taste OK, but his arthritis symptoms did not improve at all. For reference, he is a 10-year-old, 75 pound Australian shepherd mix (we think he's mixed with Burmese, but we got him at SPCA when he was about 4 months old so not sure about that). I do hope it works for others tho.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey HW

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old dog is a puppy again because of this joint supplement
customer_reviews.text: This product gave me my puppy back! I have a 10 year old dog that has, over the past couple of years, become noticeably less mobile. Takes her 30 minutes to get around the block, and her back legs look stiff/painful when she walks. Started her on Doggie Dailies Joint Supplement in July of 2019, and in a few months started noticing a difference. It’s been over 6 months now, and she’s a new dog. She runs around the block, and is more playful. I’m so grateful for this quality product at an affordable price. I tell EVERYONE about this supplement (including random people I meet on airplanes). Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: David Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend these to any owner with an arthritic dog!
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me from a friend when I mentioned that my 6 year old greyhound's arthritis was getting worse and we were having to max him on pain meds for relief. I had tried CBD oil for him, but didn't see much difference and I have tried glucosamine in the past with not much change. Within a few days of using the Doggie Dailies, I noticed a huge difference in his mobility and gate. We have even been able to significantly cut his pain meds which is exactly what we wanted to do since he's so young yet. We'll continue to use!! I would recommend them for anyone who has a dog with arthritis issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Andre

customer_reviews.title: Helps with dog hip joint issues
customer_reviews.text: My mixed-breed 9 year old dog began experiencing painful joint issues. When he began to cry as he would attempt to stand up, I began my search for a product that works, and that my dog likes. I like the quality natural ingredients that makes them work so well. At first attempt to feed my dog these treats, he ignored. So I crumbled them into his food each day. Now after about two weeks, he enjoys them. And he moves much better than before. He still is slightly stiff when walking, but he no longer cries out in pain.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Gobrecht

customer_reviews.title: They sure work for our big girl!
customer_reviews.text: My large 8 year old golden/newf mix was limping on her front paws even though we had been giving her another brand of glucosamine tablets for over a year. She loves to take very long walks twice a day (and chase the squirrels) which we had to curtail. After reading several reviews for doggie dailies we decided to give them a shot. So glad to say that she is back to her old (squirrel-chasing) self, but we limit the very long walks to 3 times per week too. The supplements are worth the price, she takes 6 every day faithfully and has never turned her nose up at them, thinks they are treats!
customer_reviews.author: YellowRose

customer_reviews.title: Not effective
customer_reviews.text: Very crumbly. Not sure if just not fresh or poorly processed. One dog eats without problem (eats anything). I have to put in cheese etc. for picky one. Tried mixing in dog food but wouldn't eat the food. (his favorite) Both elderly with arthritis. Have seen decline in mobility since switching to this product after 1 month. Will go back to sl more expensive but reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: patz

customer_reviews.title: A handful of crumbs.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a real problem. The "kibble" type pieces immediately crumble to dust as soon as you touch them. I have been giving them to my 2 chihuahuas, and while they didn't get sick like I've read in other reviews, there were also absolutely zero improvement. I would definitely not waste my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I am a vet tech for 7 years. I always encourage owners to purchase some type of supplement for larger dogs joints as they older. I have a 12 year old lab who is a bit slower and this supplement has helped her a ton with her mobility. I also recommend this to friends and clients who have German shepherds who display hip issues as this is common with that breed. They have had positive feedback about how this helps their dogs as well. I recommend this especially if you have a larger dog older than 5. Great supplement
customer_reviews.author: Jacqulyn D

customer_reviews.title: Your Dog Will Thank You Later
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 8 years old and has arthritis and her joints are giving her problems. I researched a lot of products before deciding on this one. Lots of good reviews. I’m glad I went with it. We are on month 4 of using. She’s back walking, running, and jumping around like a young dog again. She loves both flavors Peanut butter and chicken.
customer_reviews.author: SLO85

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my little seniors hopping!
customer_reviews.text: My three little ones, age 10, 11, and 12 have been on Doggie Dailies since they were about 3, 4, and 5 years old...I think it's kept them "oiled" and in great physical shape...When we walk, everyone is amazed at how agile they are, fast and active...I really do believe Doggie Dailies, every single day, after their breakfast has been instrumental in keeping them in great physical health...And all three of them look for their after breakfast "treat'! Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get my dog even try these
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get my 11.5yr old dog to eat this at all. I didn't want to force it down his throat because I saw reviews that mentioned they forced their dog to eat them they got sick. My baby can be picky but he had no interest in these at all. The smell was horrible. Seller was very helpful with refund process
customer_reviews.author: K&G Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wanted this to be the game changer
customer_reviews.text: He likes them takes them without any fuss. They're a bit dry, almost flakey like a biscuit. I really wanted these to be a game changer, but I've not noticed any change. I've ordered a different product so if I find that hes just progressed so far that these cant help I will come back and update my review. He is taking 5 daily, I've thought about increasing but he's nine and a healthy weight. We're now at the end of our first container and he is exactly the same as he was at the start. Sucks because we have another that I auto shipped. I guess puppy treats for the younger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: TaraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not potent enough
customer_reviews.text: My own fault for not verifying that the dosages were sufficient. They are simply not enough glucosamine and chondroitin needed. However, even though my two dogs loved the taste of these, one dog experienced diarrhea until the Dailies were stopped. Taking this and the low dosage into consideration, I switched to Cosequin, on sale at Costco for a great price and in the standard dosages offered by most other manufacturers. Avoid this product. It has the potential to make your dogs ill with all the weird ingredients. Stick to what it is known to work....glucosamine and chondroitin.
customer_reviews.author: Twaddlefree

customer_reviews.title: These really help my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I started using these about 1 year ago. We found out my 4 year old Shi-poo had a horrible spine and this would help in his later years. So we started him on them. We also figured we would place my old guy Shih-tzu on them. Well my young dog continued to improve and run like crazy. The big difference I saw was with my old guy. He is jumping. And his movements seem much easier. They eat them every morning without a problem. I am so happy I have these to help my dogs move easier and have better joint health.
customer_reviews.author: Loriann

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just wish they were a bit more budget friendly.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great little way to get supplements into out dogs. They stop eating breakfast just to wait on their “special treat” and gobble them right up before going back to their meals. They seem to help our thirteen year old dog with joint issues she was having. She doesn’t whine when jumping up onto the couch, and she’s gone bavk to running through the house like a crazy puppy. Great to see! I just wish they were cheaper or you got more for the price. We give one to each of our dogs (10 lbs. and 20 lbs.). They seem to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall B.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware! As noted by other reviewers, this supplement can cause diarrhea. I admit I didn’t see those reviews until after product arrived and I gave it to my 35 lb mix... Luckily I clean up after him as soon as he goes, and I saw very soft stools. Got an ok from vet for pepto bismol, gave it right away, and stopped the supplement. If you use it, keep a close eye on your pet so you don’t get any unpleasant surprises! I don’t recommend it—my dog is not “sensitive” to what he eats.
customer_reviews.author: wellbehavedwoman

customer_reviews.title: Works for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them. She takes an allergy pill every morning. So I crumble these in my palm and place her pill right in the middle and she eats it right up. She loves these things! The second she hears me opening the lid she races to me. I would definitely recommend them to anyone with a dog. The recommended doses according to the dogs weight is printed on the back so it’s pretty easy to know how many to give your dog. As far as pain relief I’m not sure how helpful these are since she’s not suffering from anything but allergies.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo365

customer_reviews.title: Working wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I put both of my pups on this product about a month ago. My 9 year old really didn't need them I don't think but I wanted to be proactive. My 14 1/2 year old Yorkie was beginning to. I am now seeing improvement in him And I he is dancing around the house like he thinks he's really something. And he is. Also my original order got lost some how and I was generously refunded and I reordered and it came right away. I will reorder when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Melba J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I could buy my girl!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yr old Jack Russel Terrier is my baby. She is a fierce protector and loving companion but recently was having difficulty walking and didn't want to walk. I also noticed she no longer wanted to sit on the soft couch with me in her usual spot. After a month of taking this supplement she is MUCH better and no longer has a limp is back to being obsessed with chasing the laser beam until she is exhausted. So happy I found and tried this supplement!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: my dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: my dogs know the order of "treats" in the evening. we get bully sticks, new chews and these. i keep forgetting about these because they are new, but my dog reminds me. paws me and looks at the bottle until i remember. my dog is a lab mix, 11 years old and still runs up the mountain peak behind my house, that is 500 ft. i think feeding glucosamine has kept him young.
customer_reviews.author: throat puncherTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I tried it for both my dogs who are just past middle age
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure because the previous product I was using was good, but as my dogs get older I see these little differences in them (how they get up, jump up and how much less running they were doing). Now after using one bottle of this product, I see a huge difference in both dogs. On yesterday's walk they ran the whole way! And the heavier of the two even jumped into the golf cart instead of needing a hand up! Good product. I found great results in my two terriers.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia

customer_reviews.title: Miracle supplement!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old female husky has arthritis and some kidney issues, so I was afraid to keep giving her pain meds. We decided to give dailes a try and I am so glad we did!!! She is like a pup again! She's energetic again and is now back to rough housing our younger dog. Our vet has even noticed a difference and she hasn't had any pain flare ups sense being on this!! I just can't sing it's praises enough, I am so happy we found this product!! Seeing my girl feel like herself again just brings me to tears, I highly recommend giving this product a try!
customer_reviews.author: SassyCassie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8 year old Doxin and she'd been having issues with her shoulder. She was bot acting her usual bubbly self and would sometimes cry a little when walking down staira. I immediately purchased these and within 2 days she was completely back to normal. I give her two a day, one with each meal, and will continue to do so. We're both very happy!! The bottle does not say this but instructions do on the product features: give them the chew with food or before/after eating as it can cause an upset stomach. I give my girl hers in her food so it's part of her meal.
customer_reviews.author: LolaRo84BtsnStrg

customer_reviews.title: Good for making dogs puke
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 dogs. I gave it to two of them, and they both vomited. I tried again a few days later, again, puked after having it. And tried a 3rd time a few weeks later. Same results. I threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Just what my baby needed
customer_reviews.text: My 11yrs old chihuahua was recently diagnosed with moderate tracheal collapse. It’s a condition that worsens with time. Although this is a joint health formula, the same vitamins and minerals that support joints also support the trachea. They are ‘tracheal builders’ which can help in the progression of tracheal collapse. My dog is only a lot of medication so it’s hard to tell if it has made a difference but she loves the taste, it makes her coat super shiny and soft and the ingredients are totally safe. I strongly recommend this if your fur baby is suffering from joint issues or tracheal collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Maude

customer_reviews.title: I am blown away by the difference in my dog ...
customer_reviews.text: I am blown away by the difference in my dog after just a few weeks of taking these supplements. As he ages, he is beginning to show signs of stiffness and discomfort in his hips after exercise. Climbing the stairs is occasionally difficult for him, especially in colder weather. I had previously tried several different supplements, food additives, etc. but was not noticing significant effect. Now, my ten year old pit mix is spring-loaded again. No matter how hard we played yesterday, he's always ready tomorrow's next adventure. Thank you Doggie Dailies Team, for putting the bounce back in my boy's step.
customer_reviews.author: cherokee blue

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves these treats!
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves these! Reilly is an 11 year old Golden Retriever whose face may have turned white but who has a lot of energy (still!) & is very active. Because he is a big boy, I started very early on to give him glucosamine so I wouldn’t worry so much about his joints. He looks forward to getting these treats - he knows he gets them after meals so he sits & waits for me to give him some. Worth every penny! He has no movement issues or arthritis. He will continue to get these forever!
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: A must for dogs succeptable to displaces.
customer_reviews.text: We have only been using these for a little less than two weeks, but when we took Paisley (Our 3 year old Shih tzu) to the Vet last week for her annual wellness check (she passed it with flying colors) he strongly recommended putting her on a joint supplement. He was pleased to learn that we had already done so. We told him that she was now getting one Doggie Dailies each morning, and his reply was “excellent choice “.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This really seem to help my older mastiffs’ arthritis, she was limping everyday from as soon as morning chores were done till the next am for a month straight. And after about 7-10 days you could see a noticeable difference. She first started limping later in the day and then not single everyday and has now not had a noticeable bad day in weeks and is in a much better mood and wants to be included in more activities . She’s about 130# and gets 5-6 a day. They seemed a little dryed out didn’t have a very “fun” smell if your dogs picky, mine is not so she’s happy to eat them no matter what.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to review this product before using it for a good month. We're on our 2nd month now and I'm pleased to say that this product works quite well. My Rottie was limping on a daily basis and now we only see him limp if he's been chasing a rabbit or squirrel and the limp is short lived. I looked at a lot of products and because of the reviews, I opted for this one. I gave it 4 stars only because I wish that it contained more Glucosamine. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: After being a steady customer, we are now unhappy with Product
customer_reviews.text: Returning our two unused bottles. Older dates on recent purchases. Fuzziness on the chews. Not healthy looking. We will stop purchasing these and returning what we have not used. The older dated material (see bottles on left) arrived recently, while the fresher bottle (on right) was almost empty when we ordered the last bottles. There is something apparently wrong with the sellers inventory control.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the peanut butter flavor
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these supplements for my pug to help with joint pain and overall joint health. He's done really well with them and went from not wanting to walk more than a few houses, to going all the way around the block. This last batch wasn't good though..it was the peanut butter flavor and not the chicken that I usually buy. They smell terrible and he doesn't even want to eat them. I have to sneak them into his food to get him to take them. And, since starting the new jar (peanut butter flavor), he's stopped wanting to walk again, so I'm assuming they're not as good as the chicken version.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Smith

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for Nelly
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, these have been a game changer for our girl, Nelly. She is our 4th German shepherd and we’ve not been able to get them to live past the age of 7, all for different reasons. Nelly started limping and having a really difficult time getting off the floor around 7 years old, so I found Doggie Dailies on Amazon and thought what do I have to lose. Probably within 2 months, she was moving better and it was easier for her to get up. Every evening she gets 6 chews with her dinner, and she just turned 10 this last July! She romps around with her 2 year old German shepherd sister every day!
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: All six of my dogs hate the flavor I
customer_reviews.text: My dogs hate this. Its hard to get them to eat it. I have six dogs and only one barely eats it with lots of encouragement. When I opened the bottle it smelled great to me. So I thought they would all love it. The ingredients seems good but my dogs just hate the flavor. It's strange because i have one that eats just about anything. Including spinach and insects...makes me scared to give it to them but i will try and come back to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: pookiegurl

customer_reviews.title: Senior dogs love these supplements.
customer_reviews.text: 6 mos. ago I adopted a 14 yr. old from local dog pound and she has severe arthritis in back leg so I wanted to try these to see if they give her some relief. She and my 7 yr. old rescue dog both took to these like they're treats. I've noticed a bit more zing in the 14 yr. olds step and she's more willing to run around the yard, so I have to assume these Doggie Dailies are helping. Both my senior dogs love them.
customer_reviews.author: Dee, from Defiance

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Doggie Dailies!
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing Doggie Dailies, we tried several similar supplements for our aging pup's hips & joints. He turned his nose up at all of them. It's very difficult to convince an Australian Cattle Dog that he'll feel better if only he will take his pills. We thought the old ones were stinky, too. But then, we read the reviews for Doggie Dailies and many people said their dogs loved the flavor. Our dear Bonzer loves the flavor, too! In fact, if you accidentally drop one on the floor, he'll scramble to grab it. He clearly feels much better and he loves his new medicine. Thank you, Doggie Dailies!
customer_reviews.author: Dondi

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: New update: We still love this product. Works great for our female Cane Corso. As an added plus the company is excellent to work with. They respond quickly to any concerns. I highly recommend this product. Their the best! We have two very large Cane Corso. Our female is 7 and has problems with her back leg. With taking these she runs and plays like a pup. Excellent product! Beware you have to give amount based on size. I give her 8 a day, but it is totally worth every penny. Highly recommend this product. Been using it for about a year or so now.
customer_reviews.author: whosit

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old yorkie-poo. He used to be really spry and then started having stiffness and limping, especially in the mornings or after a lot of activity. I have used this for almost 1 year and the results have been outstanding. It worked after a couple weeks and he is running and jumping around like when he was younger. He has had no problems with limping or stiffness. I am so grateful that this works. The price is terrific - especially since he is small and only requires one a day. He is pretty picky and he eats them with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Book Goddess

customer_reviews.title: A very happy customer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical, but also desperate, to find something to help my 11 year old, Lab/Shepherd mix with her arthritic hips! After a lot of research, and reading user reviews, I decided to take a chance on Doggie Dailies....and I’m so glad I did!! I saw some improvement after a few days, but after two weeks now my girl, Blossom, is chasing squirrels!!!! My wife commented this morning that she couldn’t believe how much better our sweet girl is doing! I was also concerned that she wouldn’t like the taste but that wasn’t an issue at all! She loves them!! Thank you Doggie Dailies!! I’m a VERY happy customer!!
customer_reviews.author: ColorsOfMusic

customer_reviews.title: Helped Alleviate My Babies Pain
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a mixed breed and built oddly as a result. She is 4 1/2 and really started having issues with arthritis, limping and just lying around not doing much. The Vet had to give her a week Rx to alleviate it and in the meantime, I bought these. It's been a few weeks and she seems to be doing great. She gets 4 chews a day as one dose due to her weight. No limping and she is back to her playful self, drama queen self. I plan to continue to buy these for her to see how they help in the long run, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: KrysLyn84

customer_reviews.title: One of the best products around!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 11 years old and started to have trouble getting up off the floor. After laying down for a bit she'd get up and have a slight limp. I also noticed she'd sometimes go slower up and down the stairs. She's about 75lbs. These doggy dailies are seriously the best! I give my dog 5 treats a day. After a week or two I started noticing an improvement. Now that I've been giving them to her for several months now, wow what a difference! I really had to add these my Amazon subscription because they are now a must have to keep my older pooch in good health. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: kaiseristhereason

customer_reviews.title: Much more pep
customer_reviews.text: Our 13 year old golden retriever was having problems with her hips and struggled to get up at times. I started giving her three of these a day about two months ago and the difference is significant. She has much more energy and is able to get up much easier. Glad I tried this.
customer_reviews.author: A.R. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love the taste.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs. 10 yrs. of age. Rottie and border collie. 100 lbs an 65 lbs. I feed 3 in morning with breakfast an 3 at night with dinner. 6 total. Both dogs had shown stiffness over the past year. They love the taste. Their stools have remained normal. The question arises are they moving better? I have used 2 an 1/2 bottles. I think my rottie has shown some improvement. Boarder collie still has issues some days. I think overall I will reorder product as I believe they need a supplement support of this nature. But am not sure of actually seeing results as many have suggested. I’m hoping so. Thank u.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: A Doggie Daily A Day keeps me and my Vet happy
customer_reviews.text: I’m really pleased to to say that these Doggie Dalies have done wonders for my sweet Bella Blu. She’s a 9 year old Pom Pom with a little bit of a hop on her back leg. Ever since I put her on these vitamins, I have noticed her springing around more and with no hop or skip in the back leg. Took about 4 weeks of a 5 day feeding before I really could tell a difference. I’m definitely a fan and will be keeping her on these.
customer_reviews.author: Germaine B. Baur

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving Doggy Dailies to my two rescued dogs for over 4 months - one pooch is 5 can run very fast circular sprints, and the other pooch is 1.5 years old with mild hip dysplasia - they seem to love the flavor and take them happily. It's a preventative measure for the somewhat older dog, while the dog with the joint issue now runs very well and appears to have strengthened the leg that slid out from under her.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Rubin

product_meta.title: Doggie Dailies Glucosamine for Dogs, 225 Soft Chews, Advanced Hip and Joint Supplement for Dogs with Glucosamine, Chondroitin, MSM, Hyaluronic Acid and CoQ10, Premium Joint Relief for Dogs
feature_bullets: 225 Soft Chews, Ingredients You Can Trust, Taste Your Dog Will Love: We've carefully crafted a healthy and delicious joint supplement for dogs that helps provide vital vitamins, minerals, essential enzymes, and nutrients your dog needs for energy and strength; Our chicken flavored hip and joint dog treats are easy to give and so delicious your dog will be begging for more

Powerful Blend of Ingredients Known to Support Dog Joint Health, Improve Mobility, and Ease Discomfort: Improving your dog's joint health is important, our soft dog treats make that easy; Every soft chew is loaded with Glucosamine HCl, Chondroitin, MSM, Yucca Schidigera, CoQ10 (coenzyme q10), and Hyaluronic Acid (HA); Plus Omega 3 & 6, Vitamin C & E, and Salmon Oil & Cod Liver Oil for skin and coat health

Help Put The Pep Back In Your Pup's Step With A Tasty Chicken Treat They'll Love: Doggie Dailies offers safe and effective hip and joint chews for dogs of all breeds, ages, and sizes; Our formula may help reduce inflammation, lubricate joints, and repair cartilage; A daily dose of our dog glucosamine can help increase your pup’s energy levels and improve their mobility and overall joint health

More Than Just Glucosamine and Chondroitin for Dogs: Every delicious chicken flavored soft chew contains the perfect balance of six powerful active ingredients that work together to cushion and protect your dog's joints; Our advanced glucosamine for dogs is made by using cold-press extrusion which helps preserve the integrity of the ingredients to ensure maximum potency for your pup

Our Dog Supplements are Made Using Strict Quality & Safety Standards: Our U.S. facility is GMP compliant and Level 3 SQF certified; Every batch of Doggie Dailies is tested by an independent lab; Order our glucosamine for dogs today and see for yourself why thousands of doggie parents trust us with their pup's wellness needs
